alert.note: Alert for Central Interior; Deltana and Tanana Flats; Denali; Eastern Alaska Range; Middle Tanana Valley; Southeastern Brooks Range; Upper Koyukuk Valley; Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country; Yukon Flats and Surrounding Uplands (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 10 at 4:16AM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...High Water Levels Possible This Weekend and Next Week... A warming trend to near or just above normal temperatures is expected across Interior and Northern Alaska later this week into the weekend. These warming temperatures, combined with a much above normal snowpack over higher elevations of the Interior, will cause a significant increase in snowmelt. Runoff into rivers south of the Brooks Range later this weekend and next week will cause water levels to rise and breakup to begin on many rivers. The increased runoff may also cause smaller streams and creeks to rise to bankfull levels or overbank in low lying areas. As of 600 PM Tuesday evening, water was reported over a portion of the Steese Highway near Milepost 145, just west of Birch Creek near Circle. Ice moving down Birch Creek caused water to rise into an old channel and go overbank along the Highway. The water levels will gradually fall as the ice continues to move down Birch Creek away from the area. People along Interior rivers and streams should prepare for the possibility of high water levels this week and next week due to ice breakup and snowmelt runoff. The latest breakup information is available at www.weather.gov/aprfc/breakupMap.
